item.title: More students head back to class without one crucial thing: their phones
item.description: This back to school season, more districts than ever have cell phone bans in place. Teachers and legislators alike say the restrictions help kids focus in class.

item.title: How Trump is decimating federal employee unions one step at a time
item.description: President Trump has ended collective bargaining rights for more than one million federal workers. Unions have sued to block the move, but agencies are terminating contracts as litigation continues.

item.title: An earthquake devastates eastern Afghanistan, killing more than 800 people
item.description: The 6.0 magnitude quake late Sunday hit a series of towns in the province of Kunar, near the city of Jalalabad in neighboring Nangahar province, causing extensive damage.

item.title: Friday night football brings healing in Kerrville
item.description: Still recovering from devastating July flash flooding, the Kerrville community gathered for the Texas tradition of high school football Friday night. As Texas Public Radio's David Martin Davies reports, the Tivy Antler varsity football team took on Del Rio in their season opener at Kerrville's Antler Stadium, the same location that was a volunteer hub after the July 4th flooding and where a recent massive memorial was held.

item.title: Iran-backed Houthis raid UN food and children's agencies in Yemen, detain employee
